dimension: 4 1/8 x 3 5/16 in. (10.48 x 8.41 cm) (image, trimmed within platemark)
text: Saint Francis is one of Lucas's most highly respected devotional images --dating from the second decade of the sixteenth century. Narrative element is minimalized --with the exception of his Franciscan habit, his stigmata, his vision of the crucifix and the belt symbolizing with three knots --the vows of obedience, poverty and chastity.It has been speculated that this engraving would have been marketed to the sewing, knitting, and clothing guilds of Saint Francis.
title: St. Francis of Assisi Receiving the Stigmata
